English: There are conflicting assignments. To apply the changes, correct the conflicts.

Grants {0} Shards.

Before the Shards, the value of exchange had been lost underground, and humanity found itself lost.

Grants {0} Moonlight Echoes.

Even though the Firrelins are considered demons on Earth, with them came the blessing that allows us to fortify our bodies and spirits.

Restores a little of life.

Bindings stop bleeding and hold back pain, giving the illusion of well-being, even with the wound still open.

Restores life.

The wisdom of intelligent races has always included the use of certain herbs to treat wounds, something that in combat can change the course of a dispute.

Restores part of life.

Many cultures worship blood, believing it to be capable of restoring the body's constitution.

Restores a lot of life.

A potion made for centuries by Yrgvonia, one of the ancient kingdoms of humanity, destroyed by the Firrelins.
Restores a large portion of health.
Restores a large amount of mana.
Reforges weapons to their maximum level.
Returns the team to the last Jernika's Shrine they rested at.
Coats the enemy in oil for 4 turns, decreasing their fire resistance.
Deals physical damage and slight posture damage to enemies.
Deals physical damage and bleeding to enemies.
Few survive combat without good protection, only almost mythical warriors can do so. There are reports of such figures throughout history, and facing them is seen as a rare honor.
Warriors of the West follow an ancient custom. After gaining experience, they seek out a certain rite that grants them something special.
It is said that barbarians have unusual strength and perhaps a common origin with the Fomludes, who disappeared shortly before their emergence.
Increases defense as more hits are landed during battle, up to a certain limit.
Increases attack power as more hits are landed during battle, up to a certain limit.
Increases the acquisition of Moonlight Echoes.
Increases damage dealt, but also increases damage received.
Increases freezing power, but decreases resistance to fire damage.
Strengthens attacks in the first 2 turns, but reduces defense in subsequent turns.
Increases the group's defense per member, but decreases damage dealt per member.
Increases the effectiveness of healing items, but reduces maximum mana.
Increases spell power, but increases casting cost.
Strengthens attacks on enemies with full health, but weakens attacks on enemies with low health.
Poisoned enemies take more damage, but they also deal more damage.
Doubles the power of healing effects, but they are divided equally among all group members.
Initiating combat by attacking deals double damage.
Grants the power to survive a deadly attack once. Restores when resting at a Jernika's Sanctuary.
Instantly counterattacks the last enemy that attacked you with your strongest weapon if the enemy's damage is greater than yours.
Grants Shards when landing a critical hit.
Passing your turn grants damage increase on your next turn.
Chance for spells to cost only half their mana cost.
Arrow bathed in mystical oil that never stops burning.
Arrow with gunpowder stuck to its tip.
Our people lived in prosperity. There were no difficulties or wars.
Until one day, or should I say one night, everything changed.
Our cerulean starry sky began to move rapidly, and then, it seemed, to fall.
Strange beings, called Firrelins, emerged from those monstrous craters and suddenly began to attack us.
Soon, the largest, supposedly star, fell and formed the largest crater, and a proportionally gigantic creature emerged from it.
We nicknamed it Vehord, the Lupine Lord.
That monstrous wolf apparently commanded the smaller creatures. And the whole attack only got worse...
As our only choice, we hid underground on our planet.
It soon became clear that the interior of the Earth was magically indestructible to the stellar beings, but still capable of being invaded, however arduously...
Over time, exploring that new world, we were shown everything the world hid.
Magic, sophisticated engineering, other races like us, and even the gods, though most were far from their full potential or dead.
We joined forces with the other beings, and over time, we established our own societies and kingdoms.
And now, we have special troops called Moonlight Travelers, who explore the entire underground in search of resources and to improve themselves
So that, when they are together, they can cross the barrier that separates the underground from the surface and face Vehord, and any other Cerulean Lords...
So that one day, we may return to the vast kingdom that was taken from us.
But you already know that story...
